alert.note: Alert for Lancaster (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 7:49AM EST until January 10 at 7:16PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Conestoga River at Lancaster affecting Lancaster County. For the Conestoga River...including Lancaster...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Conestoga River at Lancaster. * WHEN...From this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Grofftown Road will flood. At 13.0 feet, Several homes are affected by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM EST Wednesday was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.7 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
